item.content:encoded:
Real estate investment comes with ups and downs and mistakes that often influences decision making. As much as there are lots of information on the internet on how to successfully invest in real estate, little is being shared on how to avoid the common mistakes in real estate investment.

Investing in real estate requires some level of good understanding of the industry, process, and regulations that influence investment decisions in real estate. There is little or no entry barrier for real estate investment but real estate investment sometimes might be a bit challenging.

In this article, I will be sharing 5 common real estate mistakes and how to easily avoid these mistakes when investing your money.

1. Not Having a Financial Plan

Becoming a successful real estate investor goes beyond having millions of Naira to play within your account. Take into account your financial status and your budget constraints. There is a probability of 95% failure if you risk planning your budget before you make a real estate investment.

To begin with, plan a reasonable budget for your real estate investment based on the available information from professional real estate agents or industry experts. Endeavor to stick to your budgets when checking out real estate offers you are interested in before you make a serious decision.

2. Not Making Proper Research

Proper and adequate research is the bedrock of every real estate investment decisions. If you don’t have a very good knowledge of the real estate industry. you can do a quick online search about some factors such as the location, development plans or alternatively outsource the task to a real estate agent.

The research process includes getting more details about the particular property, and regulations concerning property usage. You can easily avoid this mistake by allocating time to research all potential properties before making investment decisions.

3. Neglecting Laws and Regulations

One of the most painful experience someone may ever experience in their lifetime is watching their own property get demolished for neglection the rules and regulations that bind property investment. Every investment has its regulations, laws, and guidelines that should be strictly adhered to in other to ensure a hassle-free investment.

It is advisable to take into consideration all the tax regulations, housing laws, and property regulations to avoid irreplaceable disaster with your real estate investment.

4. Not Hiring Professionals

If not egos, we all have that feeling which makes us believe we can easily get things done by ourselves. Whether or not this is true of everyone, it doesn’t apply to real estate investment. Not only is a real estate investment expensive, but it’s also highly competitive and as such needs expertise to make the right decisions.

Before you start throwing money out there trying to fix the least important thing first, consider hiring a professional real estate agent that will walk you through all the process such as searching, negotiation, and paperwork.

5. Not Having a Goal

Most investors fall the victims of just investing because there is a property for sale. Real estate is not a get rich quick scheme and shouldn’t be portrayed as one. There is a huge difference between the price of property maintenance, renovation costs and much more before you can put a property for sale at a reasonable price. After setting a realistic goal as to what you would like to achieve with your real estate investment, it is important to discuss your goals with real estate experts to validate your process.

It is advised to ask every question possible and avoid being unrealistic with your set goals as well as your budget planning.

The post 5 Mistakes To Avoid In Real Estate Investment appeared first on Sellerrand Realty Limited.

item.content:encoded:
Buying land is a great decision that should be taken very seriously considering the expensive price of lands in choice locations and the financial gains it attracts. Before making an offer whether or not a land investment is the next thing for you, there are several questions you should ask to help make better investment decisions.

In countries like Nigeria, buying a land seems like a big deal because of the level of complexity involved as well as the availability of genuine real estate agents to help your investment.

To help you make better rewarding decisions about your land investment, below are the 5 most important questions you should ask the real estate agents.

1. What are the zoning restrictions on the Land?

Zoning restrictions are popular local law that determines the kind of property structures that are allowed in a particular area.

It is advised that you make findings from the government authorities about the local regulations as regards land in other to avoid building structures that are not legally allowed in an area and may probably lead to the demolition of your prestigious properties.

2. How is the location?

Land location is considered to be one of the most important sayings and oldest real estate term as it involves buying of land. To avoid buying land with less or no value, it is advised you put much of your energy into making adequate research about the location of your desired property.

The purpose of buying land should be addressed at the point of purchase, whether you are buying for commercial property or residential property.

3. What is the land investment value?

Not everyone buys land to resell but the most individual that buy into real estate is mainly buying because of the investment value and possible return on investment. The land is a very good investment that could yield up to 100% return on investment within a short period of time.

Ask the real estate agent about the investment value and possible growth of the property before you buy land.

4. Why are you buying the property?

There are different reasons why people chose to buy land in a particular area, it could be for investment reasons or personal residence. Endeavor to balance on your interest in why you need to buy land in a particular area.

If the land is closer to a tourist attraction site, it may not be a good choice for a residential property because tourist attraction sites tend to have more potentials with commercial property.

5. What is the total cost involved?

In Nigeria, real estate is a big investment and requires lots of money. Make proper findings of the total cost that will be involved along the line so as to help make better decisions with your investment.

The cost of land is determined by some factors such as the location, size of the land, land title and the agent’s fee.

The post 5 Important Questions To Ask Before Buying A Land appeared first on Sellerrand Realty Limited.

item.dc:creator: Kolapo Imam

The post 5 Important Questions To Ask A Real Estate Agent appeared first on Sellerrand Realty Limited.
item.content:encoded:
Working with a real estate agent can become a difficult decision to make if you have little or no experience as to what is expected of you in dealing with the real estate agent. An average real estate investor is more concerned about how much they tend to gain from the investment, neglecting every other aspect of the agent’s capability to handle their project.

Unfortunately, there are currently no means by which you can tell genuine real estate agents from fraudulent ones. You can easily avoid losing your hard earned money to incompetent and heartless real estate agents.

We have compiled some critical questions you should ask any real estate agents you want to work with. Below are 5 important questions to ask a real estate agent.

1. Agent Years Of Experience

An experience they say is the best teacher, the same applies to deal with real estate agents as well. Endeavor to ask the real estate agents how long they’ve been in business. This is more important if the agents will be selling luxurious properties in high-end locations such as Lekki, Lagos.

2. Available Property Listings

Checking the agent’s listings will give you insight into the kind of properties they can handle and whether or not to move on with the discussion. Professional real estate agents regularly update their website and social media with their recent listings.

3. Ask For Reviews

This sounds more like a direct question to get to know some of the agent’s clients and their thought about his delivery. Find a way to look through some of their past clients and ask some questions about the real estate agent as well.

4. Ask About Pricing

Asking the agent about pricing will provide you with more information as to how knowledgeable they are in the real estate industry and more particular, their understanding of the local market.

5. Ask About Their Timing

You wouldn’t want to work with an agent that takes forever to sell or find you a property, probably because they don’t have the property they claim to have. If the agents can be specific as to when they can get you your desired properties or similar variations just go ahead and look for someone else.

It is advised that you treat your first meeting with the real estate agents more like an interview and an opportunity to get all of the details on all that is required to do business with them.

The post 5 Important Questions To Ask A Real Estate Agent appeared first on Sellerrand Realty Limited.

item.content:encoded:
As a first time home buyer in Nigeria, there is probably news you must have heard and you are on the lookout to stay on the safer side of the deal.

Buying your first home can be a time consuming and stressful experience. With the under-listed tips, the journey to buying your first home should be hassle-free and more fun.

Continue reading for 5 tips for first time home buyers;

1. Have a budget

Having a budget will help you stick to your initial plan and negotiate better. For example, if you are interested in a particular property you came across online via a real estate agent website that fits in perfectly to your budget, you can easily negotiate with the agent for similar other properties within your budget range.

Don’t go bankrupt buying a property you really can’t afford, experienced real estate agents will probably have several other options for you even if your budget is not so big.

2. Watch out for modern features

Considering the kind of lifestyle you chose, you should watch out for the features the house currently has and what other features can conveniently fit into space. Popular features for a modern house are an indoor bar, swimming pool, large balcony, spacious walkways and several other.

This will help you to understand what features are allowed in the community and what you can do to enhance your home.

3. Engage an experienced Realtor

Realtors are the face of every home buyers and sellers, more importantly, they can greatly influence your home buying experience. An experienced realtor should be an individual who has several years of experience and success as well s understanding of the local market you will love to buy a home.

Most individuals got realtor based on referrals or online research to check through their listings and level of understanding of the real estate market.

4. Compare pricing options in the area

Don’t just rely on your instincts or first deal, take your time to compare between other properties by looking up listings online, via social media, forums or friends and families.

Ensure you do research and make findings on the price of recently sold homes in the place goes for.

5. Ask for Agent’s fee

Most of the time, the agent’s fee might be the only reason you lose out on a great investment. Before every other serious input such as property inspection, document signing and many more. Consider asking the real estate agent for their service fee, the legal fee to avoid overpricing after closing the deal.

Do you feel it will be too difficult for you to accomplish all of the above listed yourself? Kindly visit sellerrand.com or call us on 08104980498 for more information.

item.content:encoded:
With over 100 real estate agents in Lagos only, selecting a real estate to work with can be sometimes overwhelming especially if you are new at it. Choosing the less qualified agents can be a great blow at ruining your real estate investments which can probably lead to unpleasant experience.

Real estate agents are popularly known for their unique skills, level of success in dealing with properties in different locations and several years of experience in the real estate industry.

Considering some other factors that may be unknown to the general public, our 5 steps to choosing a real estate agent is a great resource for you to invest wisely.

1.Knowledge of Real Estate Industry

In Nigeria, you don’t necessarily rely on a real estate agent for having a university degree or some physical traits. It is advised to meet with the real estate agents you would be working with in person to ask some of the specific questions that will help you know more about the agent. Some of the questions should include their knowledge of the local market, their negotiation pattern, skills and more. Asking questions will help you gauge the agent’s knowledge of the area.

2. Referrals and Research

The real estate industry is a very big market in Nigeria, fast growing as such requires some level of trust before you can drop your hard earned possessions with just anybody. Your first point of research is to talk to your family, network of friends and probably look each agent up online. It is advised to have several agents on your list to research your review and get to know more about their credibility.

3. Personal Feelings

As funny as this may sound, you will need to work with your personal intuitions too because it can go a long way in making reasonable assumptions. Real estate is a big investment and as such, you shouldn’t give out your money to someone you don’t trust. Watch out for some personality traits you might not be convenient with, do they make you feel comfortable while chatting with them? Do they maintain eye contact?

It is advised you feel comfortable talking, chatting with the real estate agent before moving along with the business.

4. Agent Strategies and Competitive Advantages

Not all real estate agents would love to share their strategies but to some extent, they should be able to give you some level of assurance. Ask the real estate agents if they offer what other agents in the industry are yet to unleash. This will help you better understand their operations and how soon they can make sales on your properties.

5. Regular Reviews

Take your time to see if you can speak with some of the agents past and current clients. The ability to maintain an ongoing review with your agent will help make communications faster and enhance your agents on how committed they are too specific needs as your property sales.

However, you might sometimes feel your agents are not doing so well as regards your property due to the local market and several other factors. Learn to follow up with the agents on periodic occasions to get updated information about the properties.

The post 5 Steps To Choosing A Real Estate Agent appeared first on Sellerrand Realty Limited.
